docs.snippet: In triumphant Rome yesterday flags flew at half mast. The capital, in the midst of celebrations of the victory over France, paused to mourn the death in battle of Italo Balbo, 44-year-old Governor General of Libya.
docs.lead_paragraph: In triumphant Rome yesterday flags flew at half mast. The capital, in the midst of celebrations of the victory over France, paused to mourn the death in battle of Italo Balbo, 44-year-old Governor General of Libya.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, June 29--Despite the alarm aroused by discovery of a Nazi plot to seize Uruguay as a German colony, South American countries have taken practically no effective steps to protect themselves against the threat of fifth column and...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, June 29--Despite the alarm aroused by discovery of a Nazi plot to seize Uruguay as a German colony, South American countries have taken practically no effective steps to protect themselves against the threat of fifth column and totalitarian agitators boring from within.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA FALTERS IN ITS ANTI-NAZI FIGHT; Argentina and Uruguay Pursue Mixed Policy of Threat and Compromise Despite Totalitarian Moves

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 29--A broad program looking to joint action by the twenty-one American republics for their common defense was presented tonight by the Pan-American "Union for consideration by representatives of the republics at a meeting in Havana...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 29--A broad program looking to joint action by the twenty-one American republics for their common defense was presented tonight by the Pan-American "Union for consideration by representatives of the republics at a meeting in Havana tentatively set for July 20.

headline.main: AMERICAS TO WORK ON A DEFENSE PLAN; Republics Will Discuss Proposals for Joint Actionat Havana SessionCARTEL PROJECT A TOPICArgentina, Brazil, Chile andUruguay Will Not Send Ministers to Conference

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, June 29--A Berlin organ for the Axis powers presented today to the American republics, which are conferring next month at Havana, the choice of coming to terms with the "new Europe" under German hegemony or feeling the economic and other...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, June 29--A Berlin organ for the Axis powers presented today to the American republics, which are conferring next month at Havana, the choice of coming to terms with the "new Europe" under German hegemony or feeling the economic and other consequences.

headline.main: AMERICAS WARNED BY AXIS ON TRADE; Berlin Foreign Office Organ Advises Friendliness to the Nazis' 'New Europe' SCORNS U.S. AID TO ALLIES Reich Radio Says Reports of Plots in South America Are Pro-British Incitement

headline.main: WICHITA DUE IN URUGUAY; Second Cruiser Is Expected to Reach Montevideo Today

docs.abstract: To attend Amer Foreign Mins conf

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1--It was learned today that Brazil helped Uruguay escape only by the narrowest of margins a serious fifth column revolt, supported by Nazi organizations, early last month.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1--It was learned today that Brazil helped Uruguay escape only by the narrowest of margins a serious fifth column revolt, supported by Nazi organizations, early last month.
docs.abstract: Aid to Uruguay to avert revolt plot described

headline.main: REVOLT IN URUCUAY AVERTED BY BRAZIL; Neighbor Massed Troops and Sent Arms on Discovery of Plot Early Last Month NAZIS THREATEN OFFICIALS Warn They Will Soon Have to Answer to a Hitler Regime for Arrest of Germans
